snippet: India’s central bank and economic analysts predict that growth will fall sharply to 7 percent this fiscal year and remain sluggish.
abstract: India's slowing economic growth is forcing leaders to make significant pro-business changes, including allowing foreign investment; skeptics wonder, however, about the impact on the nation's strict policy of protectionism; central bank predicts growth, which was 8.4 percent or higher for much of the last decade, will fall sharply to 7 percent in the current fiscal year and remain sluggish in the next one.
lead_paragraph: India’s central bank and economic analysts predict that growth will fall sharply to 7 percent this fiscal year and remain sluggish.

headline.seo: As Growth Slows, India Awakens to Need for Foreign Investment
headline.main: As Growth Slows, India Awakens to Need for Foreign Investment
